required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Has Inflammation a Significant Implication in Lung Cancer Evolution?
clinical_study.official_title: L'Inflammation A-t-elle Une Implication Significative Dans l'Ã©volution du Cancer Bronchique?

brief_summary.textblock: Systemic inflammation is a potential prognostic factor in cancer. Inflammation scores as the Glasgow score have been tested in cancer and specifically in lung cancer patients. The aim of the study is to look at the prognostic and predictive value of inflammation during cancer evolution, on the risk of complications leading to ICU admission and the risk of death.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients with newly diagnosed lung cancer will be eligible. All patients will have a blood sampling allowing testing inflammation and cytokine analyses at diagnosis, during work-up and in case of complication.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from diagnosis until death or last date known to be alive, or at least 48 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From inclusion until death, or a least 48 months
secondary_outcome.description: Recording any complication leading to consultation at the emergency department or admission into the intensive care unit

arm_group.description: Lung neoplasms irrespective of stage and histology

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Lung neoplasms irrespective of stage, histology
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previously treated lung neoplasms
- A history of prior malignant tumour, except non-melanoma skin cancer or in situ carcinoma of the cervix or cured malignant tumour (more than 5 year disease-free interval)

facility.name: Department of Intensive Care Unit and Thoracic Oncology Institut Jules Bordet
